item.title: Adoption Of Pnpm
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We’re excited to share that the Dwarves team has officially decided to switch to pnpm as our primary package management tool. After careful evaluation, we found that pnpm is widely embraced by the development community and has been successfully used by great teams at Vercel, Nx, and Chakra UI. Previously, we were using Yarn V1 classic, but as our projects grew, we faced challenges with disk space and slow installations.

item.title: Choosing The Right Javascript Framework A Deep Dive Into React Vs Angular Vs Vue
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Selecting the ideal JavaScript framework can be a daunting task, particularly when faced with an abundance of highly resourceful and capable options. To make an informed decision that caters to specific project requirements, it’s crucial to possess a deep understanding of various critical aspects. In this article, we’ll shed light on some of these essential points by conducting a comprehensive comparison of Angular, React, and Vue. item.title: A Case Study Interview Into Micro Frontends Building Design System For E Commerce Platform
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: A Case Study Interview into Micro-Frontends: Building Design System for E-commerce Platform Previously on Why Micro-Frontend, we took a look into what is Micro-Frontend architecture, as well as some core concepts behind it. For some of you that have missed the memo, hereâ€™s a tl;dr: Micro frontend architecture is an approach to building web applications by splitting the user interface into smaller, independent, and reusable parts. Each part is owned and developed by a separate team, and they are brought together in the browser to create a single, seamless user experience.

item.title: I18n Frontend Guideline
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In a front-end web application, locales are used to determine the language and geographic location of the user and to display the appropriate content to them. When a user visits a web page, the application will first detect their locale, then use this information to determine which version of the content to display. To support multiple languages and locales, the application needs to have the necessary content available for each locale.

item.description: React 18 was released in March 2022. This release focuses on performance improvements and updating the rendering engine. item.title: Jotai
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Description Jotai takes an atomic approach to global React state management with a model inspired by Recoil. Whatâ€™s better about this method or library Build state by combining atoms and renders are automatically optimized based on atom dependency. This solves the extra re-render issue of React context and eliminates the need for memoization. It scales from a simple useState replacement to an enterprise TypeScript application with complex requirements. Plus there are plenty of utilities and integrations to help you along the way!
